learning_objective: Use an iterative process to plan the development of a program by including others' perspectives and considering user preferences.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is creating a program that tracks their monthly expenses considering their income and spending on rent, food, and entertainment. They use loops and conditional statements to manage their budget and check if they have overspent. Given the following code snippet, what will be the output when Alex's income is $5000, and their expenses are as follows: rent -$2000, food -$1500, entertainment -$500?",
    "Answer1": "Budget status: Good job! You have saved $1000 this month.",
    "Answer2": "Budget status: Warning! You have overspent by $1000 this month.",
    "Answer3": "Budget status: Good job! You have saved $2000 this month.",
    "Answer4": "Budget status: Warning! You have overspent by $500 this month.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "1",
    "Explanation": "The program calculates Alex's remaining budget by subtracting their total expenses from their income. In this case, $5000 - ($2000 + $1500 + $500) equals $1000. As this remaining amount is not less than 0, the message 'Good job! You have saved $1000 this month.' gets output.",
    "code_snippet": "integer income = 5000\ninteger rent = 2000\ninteger food = 1500\ninteger entertainment = 500\ninteger remaining = income - (rent + food + entertainment)\nif remaining < 0\n    output \"Budget status: Warning! You have overspent by \" + (-remaining) + \" this month.\"\nelse\n    output \"Budget status: Good job! You have saved \" + remaining + \" this month.\"\nend"
}
